dublin_core.dcvalue: Participants in this session will engage with an interactive HIV map data that has beenused in Malawi to highlight critical information gaps and bottlenecks for strategic planningof digital systems During the session you ll experience the data for yourself in an analysisexercises Also featured in this session experts will illustrate how data culture is a result ofdata production plus information use multiplied by environmental factors Presenters willdemonstrate how theory of change models show the interplay between various elementsof the health system and how the data production and use cycle can be accelerated usingexamples from Tanzania and Zambia You ll get to map your own systems to illustratebetter how you can improve data use Presented by Breese Arenth Program Officer PATHAshley Bennett Policy Officer PATHMandy Dube Assistant Director BID Initiative PATH ZambiaHallie Goertz Learning Communications Specialist Digital Health Group PATH
Made available in DSpace on 2020-06-22T11:09:31Z (GMT). No. of bitstreams: 1 data_use_culture_deck_v3.pptx: 21499711 bytes, checksum: 4ca1bd382a6c30d13556199b46f5503c (MD5)
